title: Early Talent at OPSS: The OPSS Regulatory Leaders Graduate Scheme (RLGS)

content.text: We are dedicated to fostering the growth and development of our colleagues, helping them achieve their career aspirations.

Applications for the Regulatory Leaders Graduate Scheme (RLGS) opened on Monday the 7th of August. The RLGS will enable graduates to gain the skills, experience and knowledge to succeed in a regulatory environment.
Hear from Emily about her experience of joining the scheme:
‘At university, I studied Law with Humanities, taking most of my modules in Law, English and History.

I applied for RLGS after speaking to a member of the OPSS Graduate Hub at my university careers fair. I was drawn in when we began to discuss the wide range of roles that were available to the graduates over four unique rotations. I am currently based in the policy impact area, working within the Consumer Policy and Delivery team. I help to deliver awareness campaigns; also assisting in the creation of materials that can be published to help consumers be aware of product safety issues.

One of the key elements of RLGS is learning and development. A notable example of my recent learning is a diversity and inclusion workshop that I attended. In general, there is a wide range of learning and development opportunities available for all OPSS employees.

I always assumed that I would have a rigid career path into law after finishing my degree. However, I am excited by the fact that RLGS will help me to build a variety of skills and allow me to explore a range of different roles to find the best fit.’

Our commitment extends to nurturing talent from the very start of their careers through a variety of specialised development programs. We are especially eager to attract early talent from various groups.

We offer short-term placements, Internships and and Graduate Schemes that provide a glimpse into our work and the structure of the Civil Service. Additionally, our apprenticeships allow you to earn while you learn, combining practical experience with academic development.
